comments:
[Overview]

The Package Explorer view cannot be created on startup.

[Workaround]

Close the view and reopen it (Window > Show View > Package Explorer).

[Additional Information]

This error occured after I installed PyDev and JyDT into a clean installation of eclipse. Nothing else has been done (like installing another plugin or creating a project). There's no difference if the Java-Perspective or any other is open when Eclipse is started.

I have Eclipse perfectly running with PyDev and JyDT on a windows-machine.

Build-ID: M20060118-1600
OS: Ubuntu 5.10 (a rather new and clean installation)

[Stacktrace]

Looks more like a problem of your installation.  PackageExplorerPart has always been a part of jdt, no changes were done here.

Unfortunatly I have no idea who you could report this problem to. Tom, do you have an idea?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Unfortunatly I have no idea who you could report this problem to. Tom, do you
> have an idea?

Not really... things to try:
- try a different VM - there have been various problems with GCJ, although it works fine for me.
- does the problem really stem from using PyDev and JyDT? Does the same work again if you remove these plug-ins?

(In reply to comment #2)
> - try a different VM - there have been various problems with GCJ, although it
> works fine for me.

Seems GCJ was the problem. Using the JVM from Sun works fine. Also other problems, I encountered in the meantime, work perfectly with the other VM.

> - does the problem really stem from using PyDev and JyDT? Does the same work
> again if you remove these plug-ins?

The problem first occured after installing PyDev and JyDT. I still have no explanation for this behaviour, as the VM seems to be the real problem. Anyway, I didn't try to remove these plugins, as it works now.

Thx a lot for your help!
